alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 1:38AM EDT until July 11 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams remain high due to excess runoff from yesterday`s rainfall of 2 to 4 inches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 AM EDT, Local law enforcement reported road closures and flooded areas within the warning area. Rivers and streams will continue to recede this morning. - Road closures may continue even after the flood waters recede if the road was compromised. Never drive around barricades. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Claremont, Charlestown, Marlow, Newport, Alstead, Stoddard, Walpole, Lempster, Acworth and Goshen.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
